text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

National Donut day is a little over a week
away, it is the

first Friday of every June, so the date is
always changing.

But this year it’s on the third, 10 days
away. I like to celebrate

this food holiday by making a themed geeky donut
every year. Last year we made

Lord of the Rings themed donuts, and this
year we’re gonna be making

portal donuts! And, in the past, we have made
homemade baked donuts,

where you bake them in the oven like a cake
or a cupcake.

But this year, we are gonna be doing, for
the first time ever, traditional

donuts, fried donuts, I’m so excited. And,
if you don’t have a deep fryer

at home, that’s OK, I don’t have one either.
We’re just gonna be using a

big pot and a candy thermometer. So let’s
get started!

We are gonna be making both regular donuts,
and filled donuts today.

The things you will need, will be: 2-1/2 cups of
all purpose flour,

3/4 cup milk, 1 packet of active dry yeast,
3 tablespoons of sugar, 2 eggs,

we’re just gonna be using the yolks. 2 tablespoons
of unsalted butter,

1/2 of a vanilla bean, 1/4 teaspoon of almond
extract, 1/4 teaspoon of salt,

and, 3 circle cookie cutters, we have a small,
medium and large.

Then for the filling you’re gonna need a
jar of jam, I chose strawberry

because it’s my favorite! But you can choose
whatever kind you’d like.

1/4 cup of corn starch, and 3 tablespoons
of water, easy-peasy!

And then for the glaze you’ll need, 6 cups
of powdered sugar, and some warm

water. And then last but not least, we have
some vegetable oil for frying.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is combine
our yeast, sugar and warm

milk, remember, you want your milk warm, but
not hot, optimal temperature,

100 degrees, and you should be able to stick
your finger in, and it’s warm

to the touch. Needs to be warm because it
interacts with the yeast,
gives it a little happy home. Here you go!

Add all you sugar. Then I’m just gonna take
a spoon, and stir it all together.

Now I’m gonna let it sit for about 10 minutes,
until it becomes foamy.

Now we’re gonna pour our yeast mixture into
our large bowl.
Oooooooh!

Along with our butter, 2 eggs, remember, we’re
just using the yolks.

Using the jiggle method, just jiggling the
yolk back and forth, getting rid
of the excess egg white around it.

Now we’re gonna add our vanilla bean, over
here on a little cutting mat I’ve

got our vanilla bean cut in half, and we did
a slice down the middle.

And with a sharp cutting knife we’re gonna
scrape out our vanilla beans.

Vanilla beans are very small, there all of
our little beans!

We’re just gonna put ‘em in the bowl.
Now take your spatula, we’re gonna

give these a quick mix together. Next we’re
gonna add a third of our flour,
I’m just gonna eyeball it.
Yeah that’s a third!
And our salt. Salty!

Then we’re gonna mix together until it becomes
pasty.

It’s really important that you wait and
don’t add the salt until right now,

because the salt will kill the yeast if you
add it before.

Alright, that’s what it should look like,
and now we’re gonna add the next

third of flour, and mix it up again. It’s
gonna start to get thicker, and
that’s what we want!

We got that flour mixed in, and now it’s
time to add the last bit of flour,

our last third. And we’re gonna mix it up
for as long as we can, with the

spatula, but when it becomes too thick we’re
gonna use our hands.

I’m just gonna work the dough together until
it’s nice and smooth!

I’m got all of the dough together and now
I am moving it to the counter to be

a little bit easier to work with. I’ve sprinkled
some flour on the surface so it

doesn’t stick, now I’m just gonna keep
working it.

Our dough is ready, and now we’re gonna
grease our bowl.

I’ve got a little bit of spray, just gonna
spray it all around.

Place your dough inside, then we’re gonna
cover it with a little bit

of plastic wrap. I’m gonna set this off
to the side, until it doubles in size.

Usually it takes about an hour, but it could
be less.
Aw! The little yeast grew up so fast!

Our dough is ready, I’m gonna set it off
to the side.

Over here I’ve got some flour, I’m gonna
sprinkle it down on the surface,

so that it won’t stick. Take the plastic
off, flip your bowl upside down,
right in front of you, boop! Just like that!

Now lightly press it down, very light. Add
a little bit more flour.

We’re ready to give it a quick roll with
our rolling pin, we’re gonna be rolling
it about an inch thick.

Once your dough is rolled out, we’re gonna
cut out our donuts and

place them onto our baking sheet. Over here
I’ve got a baking sheet lined

with a piece of parchment paper, so that they
won’t stick. I’m also gonna take

a little pinch of flour, and sprinkle it onto the
parchment paper.

Now we’re gonna cut ‘em out with the largest
cookie cutter, I’m gonna cut

out three. Then take the smallest cookie cutter,
we’re gonna cut our little
donut hole. Get him outta there!

I’m gonna fry these too! They’re gonna
be my little snacks, they can come!

Transfer my regular donuts over to the tray,
and now I’m gonna take the medium

circle cookie cutter, cut out a couple of
these,
these are gonna be our filled donuts.

After you’ve got your donuts on the baking
tray we’re gonna cover ‘em with a
little towel, little kitchen towel.

Here we go, it’s like tucking them into
bed, goodnight donuts!

And we’re gonna let them sit for 20 minutes,
for them to proof!
Proofing is just the final rise in their shapes.
Ha-ha!

They’ve risen to their final form, and now
we’re gonna take our donuts,

a little baking brush, and our oil over to
the stove.

Pour oil into a large pot until it is 2/3
full. Turn heat to medium low,

until it reaches 350 degrees on your candy
thermometer.

Brush off any excess flour off the bottom
of the donut, then place gently

into the hot oil. Let the donuts brown on
one side then flip them over,
using a wooden skewer to brown the other side.

This takes about 1 minute to cook on each
side.

Remove the donuts from the oil to a paper
towel lined cookie sheet to drain.
And then do this to the rest of your donuts!
Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!

We’ve made all of our donuts and now we
are going to make our jelly filling.

The first thing that we’re gonna do is we’re
gonna take our jelly, and I’m

gonna scoop the entire thing into our saucepan.
Now I’m gonna add our water

to our cornstarch over here, and I’m just
gonna mix it up until it makes a

thick paste. Then we’re gonna take our paste,
jam, spatula and whisk
over to the stove!

Turn the heat to high and bring the jam to
a boil, stirring consistently,

you don’t want the jam to burn at the bottom
of the pan.

When the jam starts to boil, whisk in the
cornstarch paste and cook until it’s thickened,

keep mixing! When it’s thickened, remove
from heat, turn off the stove
and let it cool!

We’ve got our donuts ready, we’ve got
our filling ready, and now we’re gonna

make a little bit of glaze! It’s very simple,
in this bowl we’ve got powdered

sugar, and over here we’ve got warm water.
We’re just gonna add a little bit
at a time, until we get the right consistency.

Time to fill and glaze! I’m gonna be glazing
our regular donuts and filling

our jelly donuts! These donuts smell so good
you guys! Not eating these is

harder than completing a test chamber, let
me tell you, I’m not gonna pass!
OK, well I’ll just have one!
That is so good!
We did it! Mission complete!

This is all just optional now. But they are
gonna taste better with glaze, so…

I’m gonna do that, I'm just gonna finish
my little snack, I need to fuel up!

I’m gonna fill my jellies first, so you’re
gonna take these donuts.

And I’m gonna take a little wooden skewer,
and poke a hole here on

the side, then I’m gonna gently move my
skewer back and forth, back and forth
to create a little cavity.

I put the jelly filling in a little plastic
baggie, with a jagged tip.

And I’m just gonna place right inside the
hole, start to squeeze, move it back

and forth, da-dew! Now you’re gonna do this
to the rest of your jelly

filled donuts! We’re done with our jelly
donuts, and, I am not gonna glaze these

because I am gonna decorate them with icing,
they’re gonna have their

own frosting, very shortly, but, I wanted
to glaze our regular donuts because

they don’t have any jelly filling! They
needed a little yummy-ness!

So you’re just gonna take 1 of these guys,
plop him in, and then flip him over,

I’m just using my hands, you’re just gonna
use your hands, it’s messy, but

it’s a lot of fun! Then you’re gonna pick
him up, ooop!

And I’m just placing him over here, it’s
on top of a drying rack with a

baking sheet underneath to catch the extra
glaze.

You’re gonna do this to the rest of your
regular donuts, and your little donut holes!

Now we’re gonna let these little donuts
sit and set for about 45 minutes.

Our donuts are ready and now it’s time to
decorate, this is my favorite part!

Over here I’ve got some of our regular donuts
and to decorate I have blue

and orange royal icing, I put them into plastic
baggies, and put a little tip

at the end, for more control. This one is
a #3, and now what I’m gonna do is I’m

gonna pipe 2 big circles, 1 blue, 1 orange,
on top of our donuts to look
like the portal entryway and exit!

I’m gonna be frosting the inner circle first,
then I’m gonna frost the
outer circle, then we’re gonna fill it in.

Then you can take a little toothpick and use
it to move around the royal icing.

Now I’m gonna do the same thing, but in
orange over here.

Da-dew! Look at this, it looks like both portals
in the game, it’s so cool!

I’m gonna let these sit for a few minutes
to harden. And then, I’m gonna take

it up a notch, not only are they going to
look like the portals, but, with

the darker blue, and darker orange, I’m
gonna pipe on some triangles to look
like the Aperture logo! Boom!
These are gonna look awesome!

Just a quick reminder, there are 8 triangles
on the Aperture logo!
Boom! We’ve got our portal donuts decorated.

And now, we are going to decorate our jelly
donuts!

To decorate our jelly donuts we’ve got a
bunch of different royal icing.

We have a dark gray, a lighter gray and a
pink, to decorate 1 of our donuts
to look like little Companion Cube!

And then dark brown, red and white royal icing,
to make this 1 look like
the chocolate portal cake!

You’re gonna take your brown royal icing,
I put these all into plastic
baggies with little tips at the end.

And we’re just gonna eyeball it, we’re
gonna pipe on a circle to cover the top

of your donut. And now we’re gonna fill
it in.

You can also use a toothpick again, to smooth
out your icing.

We’re gonna let this donut set, and I’m
gonna cover this 1 in dark gray.

Again, we’re gonna pipe a circle all the
way around our donut and then fill it in.

These both sat out for a little bit, they’ve
hardened, and now I’m gonna add

the details, I’ve got my white royal icing,
and here I’m gonna add 8 circles

on the outside. Then I’m gonna let these
sit, and I’m gonna add the details
onto my Companion Cube!
Our last 2 icing details will be red and pink.

Red for our chocolate cake and pink for our
companion cube!

We’ve got our little Companion Cube and
our chocolate cake, again this part is

totally optional, but the chocolate cake always
has a candle in the middle.

So I’ve cut down a little white candle into
these small little candles,

so you can make as many donuts as you’d
like.

But I’m just gonna place these, little cut
candle right in the middle.

The frosting will crack just a little, but
that’s OK!
Aw!
Ta-da!

Here are the Portal Themed Donuts that we
made today!

In celebration of National Donut Day, that
is coming up soon!

If you guys make a geeky donut, or any of
these donuts, please take a picture

and send it to me! I love seeing your baking
creations, it makes my day!

And, I love donuts, I am super excited about
the donuts that we made today

because it is the first time on Nerdy Nummies
that we have made a traditional

fried donut! We’ve made baked donuts before,
but never a fried donut, so,
yum-yum-yum! They are my favorite, you guys!
They are my favorite, this was a triumph!

I’ll be posting pictures of these treats
on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter and Instagram.

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen.
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
And Happy National Donut Day!
Let’s see if this thing actually works!?!?
Hmmm-hmmm-hmmm-hmmm-hmmm-hmmm-hmmm!
Oh my gosh!
